questions.question_text:
//IMG//
Refer to the exhibit. The green policy is designed with low delay, and the pink policy is designed with low cost. What is the next hop for node A on its way to node D, with the objective of achieving a low delay?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/td/docs/ios-xml/ios/iproute_isis/configuration/15-mt/irs-15-mt-book/isis-inbound-filtering.html

Example: Configuring Route Filtering by Next Hop (or Route Source)

The following example shows how to enable IS-IS inbound filtering using next hop or a route source:

Device(config)# ip prefix-list List2 seq 5 deny 198.51.100.31/24
Device(config)# interface fastethernet 0/0
Device(config-if)# ip router isis 125
Device(config-if)# router isis 125
Device(config-router)# distribute-list gateway List2 in

Selected Answer: A
I learnt something new, NOT in the official Cisco SPRI training

R2(config)# interface fastethernet 0/0
R2(config-if)# ip router isis 122

R2(config-if)# router isis 122 -
R2(config-router)# distribute-list prefix List1 in

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
You need the next-hop self configured on CE1 to change the next hop from the eBGP next hop in the route from the PE1 router to make it reachable for CE2

Selected Answer: D
Answer is D

choices.B: Configure CE1 to send routes to CE2 with a higher MED.
choices.A: Add the lower local-preference value on PE2 towards CE2.
choices.D: Add the next-hop self command to the CE1 neighbor statement for CE2.
choices.C: Configure CE1 to send routes to CE2 with a higher weight.

discussion.content: So, like DUsoo said, we need "set as-path prepend last-as" for inbound as-path prepend manipulation so that route-map is not doing anything right now. But looking at the other options there is nothing useful. LP of 200 on R2 would work but this is talking about R1!?

comments.content:
Ouu, looks like when we want to prepend AS in inbound direction, there should be
"set as-path prepend last-as" command.

discussion.content: This Q doesn't make a sence. As it is configured now, R2 should be exit point because R1 has prepended AS path.

choices.A: Add a sequence number to the route map to remove the implicit deny.
choices.B: Change the route map direction in the neighbor statement to out.
choices.D: Remove the neighbor statements from the address family configuration and activate the neighbor globally on R1.
choices.C: Configure the route map with a local preference of 200 or higher.
